robotcontrol

Class RobotController

  • java.lang.Object
    • robotcontrol.RobotController

  • public class RobotController
extends java.lang.Object

    Controller class with main functionality

    RobotController is the basic functional class of this program. All the controlling is done from here, threaded tasks are delegated to an instance of IRChecker.

    Some of these methods could have been implemented elsewhere (in other classes), but this program is basically the Frankenstein's monster of EV3 programs. Not pleasant to look at.

    At least it's fairly well commented.

    Version:
    0.3.1
    Author:
    Simo Hyttinen

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotController

        public RobotController()
        Constructor takes no parameters. Starts the infra red sensor checker.

    • Method Detail

      • runProgram

        public void runProgram()
        The basic functionality of the program: Asks if the user wants to drive or schedule a program. Those functions are performed in separate functions.

      • listenToInput

        private void listenToInput()
        Contains the while loop (terminatable by pressing ESCAPE on the EV3) that checks for user input from the IR sensor and delegates the received input accordingly to the appropriate methods. Also checks if touch sensor is activated. If it is, starts the obstacleHit() method which stops the robot and reverses a bit.

      • scheduledProgram

        private ScheduleProgram scheduledProgram()
        Contains the menu in which the schedulable program is determined. Returns a ScheduleProgram instance (or null if the user exits).
        Returns:
        An instance of ScheduleProgram that is the selected program.

      • writeProgram

        private ScheduleProgram writeProgram()
        Menu where programs can be created for scheduled execution. Prompts the user for amount of actions and which actions should be performed.
        Returns:
        Returns the user-written program.

      • customProgramAmount

        private int customProgramAmount()
        Gets the amount of custom programs to determine how to name the next custom program.
        Returns:
        The amount of custom programs in memory.

      • getActionName

        private java.lang.String getActionName(int actionID)
        A basic switch method for getting a String name for a numeric ID of a programmable action.
        Parameters:
        actionID - The numeric ID for the action
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the action as a string

      • scheduledProgramWaitTime

        private int scheduledProgramWaitTime()
        Menu for determining the length of the waiting period before executing selected program.
        Returns:
        The selected waiting time as an integer

      • moveTracks

        private void moveTracks(int direction)
        Moves the tracks according to given parameters.
        Parameters:
        direction - Integer that determines the direction of movement.

      • moveFist

        private void moveFist(int direction)
        Swings the fist around according to given parameters.
        Parameters:
        direction - Integer that defines the direction in which to move the fist.

      • obstacleHit

        private void obstacleHit()
        Stops the motors and reverses them half a turn before letting the user continue driving.

      • executeProgram

        private void executeProgram(ScheduleProgram program)
        Reads the list of maneuvers in given program and iterates through them sending then to programedManeuver() to be executed while doing so.
        Parameters:
        program - The program which is to be executed.

      • programmedManeuver

        private void programmedManeuver(int maneuver)
        Executes maneuvers requested by executeProgram().
        Parameters:
        maneuver - The numeric case number for the next executable maneuver.
